1553122211.content:
You wake up and go into the bathroom for your morning whiz. You stop in front of the mirror and look at your bushy, black unibrow. Today's a school day. Great. You sigh and mutter "I've got to get this thing cut." You wash your face and head downstairs.

When you get down you see your sister Stacey eating cereal on the couch. She gives you a big smile and says "Hi Jack! Sleep well?" You smile back and say yes. She giggles slightly, but you aren't sure why. Your mom also greets you and hands you your own bowl of cereal. She asks, "Do you want to get that brow fixed this week, sweetie?" You're about to say yes, but you have a sudden change of heart. "No, mother, I'm very proud of my unibrow." "As you should be," says your mother, now sporting a giant black unibrow of her own. "It's run in the family for generations. Besides, yours is perfect! It's completely bushy throughout, without any thin spots." "Yours is beautiful as well, mother," you say, not noticing that she suddenly grew one or the fancy way your mother and you are talking. Meanwhile, Stacey is close to having a laughing fit.

"It's just a damn shame that Stacey doesn't possess such a majestic brow," you say, staring at her boring, commoner brow. She shrugs and says, "I can't do anything about my genes, bro." "That may be true," you say, "but you could make an effort to improve your language and show more respect to your family." Your mother says "Just give her time, my son. She'll learn." But then she nods, showing that she agrees with you. You smirk. You always were her favorite.

"Well, you two had best get prepared for school," your mother says. You nod in agreement and finish your cereal. While getting ready, you look at your nails and sigh. "I simply must get these lacquered," you mutter. You fail to notice chuckling Stacey behind you.

You get into your mother's car with Stacey and go to...
